com.unvired.database
Interface IDataStructure

All Known Implementing Classes:
ApplicationMeta, AttachmentItem, AttachmentOutObject, AttachmentQObject, BusinessEntityMeta, DataStructure, ErrorStructure, FieldMeta, FrameworkSettings, InfoMessage, InObject, Log, MobileAppSettings, MobileUserSettings, OutObject, QueryFunction, SentItemObject, Settings, StructureMeta, SystemCredential, Version
public interface IDataStructure

IDataStructure represents application data as a business object.

  • Unvired data model consists of a set of Business Entities.
  • Business Entity is a logical construct consisting of a header item and other children items (Note: Terms Structure and Item are used interchangeably). Business Entity can have only one Header and many children Items.
  • Header / Item is a collection of Fields.
  • Field is a field name and value pair.
A sample data model is provided below: 
 <Application name="CRM" description="CRM Mobile App" version="1.0" dbversion="1.0" package="com.mycompany.crm" namespace="mycompany">
 		<BusinessEntity name="CUSTOMER" description="Customer">
 			<header className="com.unvired.template.saperp.so.be.CUSTOMER" description="" name="CUSTOMER_HEADER">
 				<Field name="CUSTOMER_NO" description="Customer No" sqlType="TEXT" isGid="true" length="10" mandatory="true" />
 				<Field name="CUSTOMER_NAME" description="Customer Name" sqlType="TEXT" length="12" mandatory="true" />
 				<Field name="STREET" description="Street" sqlType="TEXT" length="50" mandatory="false" />
 				<Field name="CITY" description="City" sqlType="TEXT" length="50" mandatory="false" />
 				<Field name="PIN_CODE" description="Pin Code" sqlType="TEXT" length="10" mandatory="false" />
 			</header>
 			<item className="com.unvired.template.saperp.so.be.CUSTOMER_CONTACT" description="" name="CUSTOMER_CONTACT">
 				<Field name="CUSTOMER_NO" description="Customer No" sqlType="TEXT" isGid="true" length="10" mandatory="true" />
 				<Field name="CONTACT_NO" description="Contact No" sqlType="TEXT" isGid="true" length="12" mandatory="true" />
 				<Field name="CONTACT_NAME" description="Contact Name" sqlType="TEXT" length="50" mandatory="false" />
 				<Field name="TEL_NO" description="Telephone No" sqlType="TEXT" length="10" mandatory="false" />
 			</item>
 		</BusinessEntity>
 	</Application>

Overview

All headers and items in the Business Entity are represented as IDataStructure. The headers and items of the business entities extend DataStructure. DataStructure is the default implementation of IDataStructure. When headers and items are fetched from the database the objects are of type IDataStructure. The following topics about the IDataStructure are covered here:
  1. Keys
  2. Fields
  3. Status
  4. Relationships
  5. Database Operations
  6. Info Messages
  7. Generation

Generation

Application data model is created using the Unvired Designer Tool. Unvired Designer is a plugin to Eclipse used to model the application. Once the application is modelled the business objects can be generated. The business entities modelled are generated as Java objects. The headers and items are generated as separate Java objects. If required the Java objects can also be handwritten. All data model objects have to extend DataStructure.

Keys

IDataStructure recognizes data uniquely in 2 ways.
  • LID - Local identifier. A local identifier is a technical key that uniquely identifies each data structure object uniquely. LID is represented by the field FIELD_LID. Each data structure object contains a field called LID and LID is like the primary key for the data structure.
  • GID - Global Identifier. A global identifier is a business key that uniquely identifies each data structure object uniquely. GID can be a single field or a set of fields. One of more fields are marked as GID fields in the data model. For a particular type of data structure all data structure rows should have unique GID fields. GID fields are similar to a composite primary key.
Fields that form the GID can be obtained using getGidFieldNames(). GID fields' values can be obtained using getGids().

Header and Item Relationship

Header and item are related through the FIELD_FID. FIELD_FID of the item should have the FIELD_LID value of the header. FIELD_FID of the header is empty. While inserting business objects to the database the FIELD_FID of the item has to be explicitly set with the FIELD_LID of the header.

Foreign Key Relationships

Apart from the header and item relationship via FIELD_FID no other foreign key relationship is supported in the data model. Other related data structures have to be logical relationships.

Database Operations

Database operations on the data structure objects are achieved via IDataManager.

Statuses

Data structure objects (both header and item) have statuses representing their current states. 'Object Status' field at the BE level is used to indicate data action (GLOBAL, ADD, MODIFY or DELETE) and 'Sync Status' field at the BE level is used to indicate synchronization state (OUTBOX, SENT_ITEMS or ERRORS). 
     
 OBJECT_STATUS: Object status indicates the state of the data. OBJECT_STATUS is available at both the header and item level.
        i.  GLOBAL – Data sent from the server
        ii. ADD – Data added on the mobile device
        iii.MODIFY – Data modified on the mobile device
        iv. DELETE – Data marked for deletion on the mobile device
 
     
 SYNC_STATUS: Sync status indicates the state of the data exchange. SYNC_STATUS is available at both the header and item level.
        i.  NONE – No status associated, by default there is no value for the SYNS_STATUS field
        ii. QUEUED – Queued in the outbox to be sent to the server
        iii.SENT – Sent to the server and waiting for a response
        iv. ERROR – Response obtained from the server and has resulted in an error

    InfoMessages

    All errors and warnings associated with the data structure during a synchronization with the server are stored as InfoMessage. InfoMessages related to a data structure can be obtained using getInfoMessages().

    getBEName

    java.lang.String getBEName()
    Gets the business entity name to which the structure belongs to.

    Returns:
    Returns the business entity name.

    getTableName

    java.lang.String getTableName()
    Gets the data structure name. The sturcture's name is also the name of the table in the database.

    Returns:
    Returns the data structure / table name.

    isHeader

    boolean isHeader()
    Checks if the data structure is a header.

    Returns:
    Returns True, if the data structure is a header. Otherwise false.

    getLid

    java.lang.Long getLid()
    Gets the lid of the data structure.

    Returns:
    Returns the Lid of the data structure.

    setLid

    void setLid(java.lang.Long lid)
    Sets the lid of the data structure

    Parameters:
    lid - Lid value of the data structure.

    getFid

    java.lang.Long getFid()
    Gets the FID of the data structure. Header and item are related through the FIELD_FID. FIELD_FID of the item should have the FIELD_LID value of the header. FIELD_FID of the header is empty. While inserting business objects to the database the FIELD_FID of the item has to be explicitly set with the FIELD_LID of the header.

    Returns:
    Return the fid. Fid of the header is empty.

    setFid

    void setFid(java.lang.Long fid)
    Sets the fid of the data structure. Header and item are related through the FIELD_FID. FIELD_FID of the item should have the FIELD_LID value of the header. FIELD_FID of the header is empty. While inserting business objects to the database the FIELD_FID of the item has to be explicitly set with the FIELD_LID of the header.

    Parameters:
    fid - Lid of the header has to be set as the fid in the item data structure. Fid should no be set for headers.

    getTimeStamp

    java.lang.Long getTimeStamp()
    Gets the time stamp of the last modification of the data structure.

    Returns:
    Return the time stamp in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

    setTimeStamp

    void setTimeStamp(java.lang.Long timeStamp)
    Sets the time stamp of last modification of the data structure in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

    Parameters:
    timeStamp - Timestamp of last modification of the data structure in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

    setField

    boolean setField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                 java.lang.Object value)
    Sets the value for the given field.

    Parameters:
    fieldName - Field name that has to be set with the given value.
    value - Value to be set to for the field.
    Returns:
    Returns true, if setting the value to the field is successful.

    getGids

    java.lang.Object[] getGids()
                           throws DBException
    Gets the values associated with the GID (global identifier) fields.

    Returns:
    Returns the values associated with the GID fields.
    Throws:
    DBException - Throws a DBException when the values cannot be fetched from the database.

    getChildrenTableNames

    java.lang.String[] getChildrenTableNames()
                                         throws DBException
    Gets the names of all the children structures (items) of the header. This method is only applicable for header data structures.

    Returns:
    Returns the children structure names
    Throws:
    DBException - Throws a DBException when the values cannot be fetched from the database.

    getInfoMessages

                              throws DBException

    Throws:
